### 2. Source Code Files

#### `src/main.cpp` (278 lines)
**Purpose**: Working flight simulator demo

**Features Implemented**:
- OpenGL rendering with Phong lighting
- Flight physics (pitch, roll, yaw, velocity)
- Camera system (first-person and third-person)
- Input handling (keyboard controls)
- Basic terrain rendering (ground plane, mountains)
- Navigation rings (checkpoint placeholders)
- Skybox rendering
- Game loop at 60 FPS

**Key Functions**:
- `main()` - Entry point and GLUT initialization
- `init()` - OpenGL setup (lighting, depth testing)
- `display()` - Render loop
- `update()` - Game logic loop (16ms timer)
- `updatePhysics()` - Flight dynamics
- `updateCamera()` - Camera positioning
- `drawAircraft()` - Aircraft rendering (placeholder)
- `drawTerrain()` - Environment rendering
- `drawSky()` - Skybox rendering

**Controls Implemented**:
- W/S: Pitch up/down
- A/D: Roll left/right
- Q/E: Yaw left/right
- C: Toggle camera mode
- ESC: Exit

### 3. Build Configuration

#### `CMakeLists.txt` (73 lines)
**Purpose**: Cross-platform build system

**Features**:
- CMake 3.10+ compatibility
- C++17 standard
- Platform detection (macOS, Linux, Windows)
- Automatic library detection:
  - OpenGL (all platforms)
  - GLUT (native on macOS, freeglut on others)
  - GLEW (Linux/Windows only)
- Compiler warnings enabled (-Wall -Wextra)
- Build output organization (bin/, lib/)
- Installation targets
